meanings.definition: Of or relating to existence or being.
meanings.sent1: The ontic nature of the tree made it a vital part of the forest ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ontic properties of matter to understand its fundamental nature.
meanings.sent3: The ontic essence of the unicorn made it a magical creature in the story.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had an ontic quality that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the ontic beauty of the landscape in his painting.

meanings.sent1: The ontic reality of the ghostly figure sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins were a reminder of the ontic history of the civilization.
meanings.sent3: The ontic presence of the monster under the bed was just a child's imagination.
meanings.sent4: His dreams felt ontic, as if he could reach out and touch them.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky held an ontic significance for the ancient sailors.
